abstract: An article last Sunday about James D. Farley, the chief marketing officer of the Ford Motor Company, referred incorrectly to his grandfather’s work history there. While the grandfather was indeed hired by Ford in 1914, he did not immediately work at its Rouge plant. (The plant’s construction did not begin until 1917.).
